p: The EQCM response accompanying doping/dedoping of the poly-[NiAmben] film shows non-monotonic electrode mass variation Δ m with potential (the data obtained at v s = 0.01 V s −1 are shown in Figure 6b as an example). Charge injection, which starts at −0.57 V in the forward scan and continues up to 0.93 V in the reverse scan ( Figure S3), is accompanied by an overall increase in the electrode mass. The plot of Δ m against the corresponding variation in oxidation charge Δ Q ox ( Figure S4a) shows several reasonably linear regions. The effective molar mass of electrolyte species exchanged during oxidation, M ox , was calculated from the respective slopes of the plot as described in [ 31]. The values of n ox were calculated for each potential range of constant M ox value by substituting the values of Δ Q ox into Equation (1). The obtained results are summarized in Table 3. They suggest that charge injection into poly-[NiAmben] proceeds through sequential generation of several redox states in the polymer.
